alert.note: Alert for Armstrong; Palo Duro Canyon; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 13 at 5:31PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Armstrong and southeastern Randall Counties through 600 PM CDT... At 531 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles northeast of Happy, or 17 miles southeast of Canyon, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wayside and Palo Duro Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for the Panhandle of Texas.
